docs.title: Data Cleaning
docs.text:
Here are the primary considerations.

  • Make sure data has a tabular structure
  • Make sure data has the proper format for numbers
  • Make sure missing values are kept empty

docs.title: Tabular Structure
docs.text:
Data needs to be in a table structure: Columns and Rows, where each Column has a header.

  • No empty rows
  • No empty columns
  • A column header for each column

docs.title: Number Formats
docs.text:
• Numbers should use decimal with dots "."
  • Numbers should not have commas in them

For users in some European regions (e.g., Germany and the Netherlands), Microsoft Excel will use the comma , for decimals.

docs.title: Missing values
docs.text: • Replace the missing value characters (e.g., NA, NaN, n/a) with empty values, i.e., remove them

docs.title: Data Uploading
docs.text:
• Check the type column has a type, character or numeric
  • Make sure a numeric column is not seen as a character. This can happen if one entry is a character

docs.title: Data Wrangling
docs.text:
The three concepts that help wrangling are

  • Measurement
  • Observation
  • Variable (feature)

These concepts are usually expressed in the form of two files

  • Measurement file
  • Sample annotation file

The measurement file is usually in a wide format.

docs.title: Correlation analysis
docs.text:
To perform correlation, you need to use the correlation_operator

Observation A B C D E obs1 2.2 1.0 2.3 5.2 0.5 obs2 2.2 1.0 2.3 5.2 0.5 obs3 2.2 1.0 2.3 5.2 0.5
